client_profile: Family with a 2-year-old buying in Brussels, seeking a 2+ room apartment. Budget EUR 490k-895k. Priorities: safe and calm streets, parks within 15-minute walk, cafes for weekend brunch.
must_have: Within a 15-minute walk of a park or playground.
School or daycare reachable within a 20-minute walk.
Quiet street away from major traffic arteries.
Elevator or ground-floor access suitable for a stroller.
nice_to_have: Balcony or terrace of at least 6 sqm.
Energy label C or better for efficiency.
Separate laundry or storage room for gear.
Parking space or easy resident street parking.
Within a 10-minute walk to metro or tram.
red_flags: On or overlooking a major road or tram depot.
Poor sound insulation causing late-night noise from bars.
No elevator for a unit above the 2nd floor.
Pending facade or roof works without a funded reserve.
Damp basement indications or known seepage risk zone.
contradictions: Premium communes increase safety and parks but can strain the budget.
Top-floor light improves comfort but reduces stroller convenience without an elevator.
Proximity to cafes raises vibrancy but may add evening noise.
Older charm offers space but often worsens energy performance and insulation.

top_districts.name: Woluwe-Saint-Lambert
why: Roodebeek metro offers quick city access and daily conveniences within a family-friendly streetscape.
Parc Malou adds green play space and quiet walking loops within a 15-minute stroller reach.
watch_out: Along Woluwe Shopping corridors, traffic and weekend parking can feel heavy during peak retail hours.

top_districts.name: Woluwe-Saint-Pierre
why: Stockel village brings cafes, Saturday market, and daily conveniences with a relaxed neighborhood feel.
Parc de Woluwe delivers lakes, playgrounds, and shaded loops ideal for stroller-friendly afternoon walks.
watch_out: Renovated family-size apartments near Stockel often push budgets and attract multiple competing bids.

top_districts.name: Watermael-Boitsfort
why: Place Wiener concentrates bakeries, weekend markets, and cafes, giving village vibes with practical daily convenience.
Sonian Forest offers vast trails, playgrounds, and cycling paths within easy 15-minute walks from homes.
watch_out: Few late-evening options; plan for earlier dinners or short drives to livelier communes.

questions_for_agent_landlord: What is the all-in purchase cost including taxes, fees, and registration?
Are urban planning permits, PEB certificate, and electrical compliance documents available?
What are current monthly co-ownership charges and planned works in the meeting minutes?
What is the condition of roof, boiler, and windows, and date of last service?
What timeline do the sellers prefer, and how flexible is the price?
next_steps: Confirm mortgage capacity and obtain a financing attestation.
Set alerts on key portals with preferred communes and budget.
Prioritize micro-areas and schedule 5-7 viewings in the next 2 weeks.
Arrange technical inspection and notary consult before submitting an offer.
clarifying_questions: Do you need 2 or 3 bedrooms and what minimum interior size feels right?
Which daily routes matter most for walking with a stroller and daycare?
Would you consider light renovations or prefer fully turnkey condition?
